thread.title: T-R high school tournament report for Oct. 24
thread.title_full: T-R high school tournament report for Oct. 24

author: TimesReporter.com staff report
title: T-R high school tournament report for Oct. 24
text: Posted Oct. 25, 2015 at 12:08 AM By TimesReporter.com staff report Posted Oct. 25, 2015 at 12:08 AM VOLLEYBALL Trojans sweep to sectional title Mariah Horstman had 15 points and 15 assists and Kierrah Stewart and Kayla Hall each recorded 12 kills as state-ranked Tusky Valley downed West Muskingum 25-11, 25-7, 25-7 to claim the Division III upper-bracket sectional title in high school volleyball tournament action Saturday. Tusky Valley (18-5), ranked No. 9 in the state in the final Ohio High School Volleyball Coaches state poll, will face Garaway at 6 p.m. Wednesday in a district opener at Strasburg. Other matches • No. 9-seeded Garaway upset No. 5-seed Barnesville in three sets 25-20, 25-22, 25-17 to claim the Division III upper-bracket sectional title. The Pirates (12-12) will take on No. 2 seed Tusky Valley at 6 p.m. Wednesday at Strasburg. Cassidy Widder had 19 assists and 18 digs and Allison Luneborg added 11 kills, five blocks and seven digs for the winners. • Ridgewood disposed of visiting Edison 25-13, 25-17, 25-15 to claim the Division III lower bracket sectional title. The Generals (21-3) move on to a district semifinal match against Buckeye Trail at 6 p.m. Wednesday at Indian Valley. Allie Dobson had 11 kills, five blocks and two digs and Laura Crawford added seven kills, three blocks, three digs and 10 points for the winners. • Central Catholic claimed the Division IV sectional title with a 25-12, 25-17, 25-14 win over visiting River. Alexis Gilland recorded 13 points with seven aces, while Maggie Dominick had 18 assists and Sydney Gilland added 16 kills and 15 assists to pace the Saints. The Saints will face Shenandoah or Steubenville Catholic Central at 6 p.m. Wednesday at a site to be determined. • Carrie Meenan had 26 points, 18 assists and 13 digs to help lead Malvern to a 25-12, 25-10, 25-15 win over Frontier to claim the Division IV lower bracket sectional title. Sara Loomis added 15 kills and 10 points and Kelci Hulit contributed 17 kills for the Hornets (18-6) who will face top-seeded Fort Frye at 6 p.m. Wednesday at a site to be determined. • Top-seeded Buckeye Trail upended Sandy Valley 25-15, 25-18, 25-11. Tyler Kerchner had 11 kills and 12 digs while Alyssa Sines added 11 assists and 8 digs for the Cardinals. Buckeye Trail will face No. 3 seed Ridgewood in a district semifinal match Wednesday. Tusky Valley 25-25-25, West Muskingum 11-7-7 Division III Sectional Final Tusky Valley–Sam Pruett 4 aces, 5 kills, 15 assists, 14 points; Keirrah Stewart 12 kills, 8 digs; Kayla Hall 12 kills, 7 digs; Jenna Franks 10 digs; Mariah Horstman 15 assists, 15 points. Records–Tusky Valley 18-5. Central Catholic 25-12, 25-17, 25-14, River 12-17-14 Division IV Sectional Final Central Catholic–Alexis Gilland 13 points, 7 aces, 9 kills; Sydney Gilland 8 points, 3 aces, 16 kills, 15 assists; Lauren Fredericks 9 points, 7 kills; Maggie Dominick 18 assists. Malvern 25-25-25, Frontier 12-10-15 Page 2 of 3 - Division IV Sectional Final Malvern–Morgan Oldack 7 points, 15 assists; Sara Loomis 10 points, 3 aces, 15 kills, 5 blocks, 8 digs; Carrie Meenan 26 pionts, 3 aces, 18 assists, 13 digs; Kelci Hulit 17 kills, 2 blocks. Records–Malvern 18-6. Ridgewood 25-25-25, Edison 13-17-15 Division III Sectional Final Ridgewood–Allie Dobson 11 kills, 5 blocks, 2 digs; Laura Crawford 7 kills, 3 blocks, 3 digs, 10 points; Sydney Zinkon 10 points, 4 aces, 10 assists, and 5 digs; Morgan McDorman 6 digs, 9 points; Erinn Buchanan 5 blocks, 3 kills, 7 points; Eliza Haynes 15 assists, 6 digs, 2 kills; Autumn Brown 3 kills, 2 blocks. Records–Ridgewood is 21-3 and will face Buckeye Trail at Indian Valley Wednesday at 6 p.m. in a district semifinal. Garaway 25-25-25, Barnesville 20-22-17 Division III Sectional Final Garaway–Cassidy Widder 19 assists, 18 digs; Allison Luneborg 11 kills, 5 blocks, 7 digs; Samantha Putt 6 kills; Abby Detweiler 6 kills, 13 digs; Grace Chapman 4 kills, 2 blocks; Alli Yoder 5 kills, 9 digs, 2 aces; Amber Monigold 12 digs; Ellen Stingel 11 digs. Records–Garaway is 12-12 and will play Tusky Valley at 6 p.m. Wednesday at Strasburg. Buckeye Trail 25-25-25, Sandy Valley 15-18-11 Division III Sectional Final Sandy Valley–Tyler Kerchner 2 points, 11 kills, 12 digs; Alexis Crone 4 points, 2 kills, 5 digs; Jackie Frederick 13 digs; Alyssa Sickafoose 4 points, 3 kills, 5 digs; Alyssa Sines 2 points, 11 assists, 8 digs. BOYS SOCCER Hawks shut out Trojans for title Sinjon Howell and Derek Miller each scored two goals and five other Hiland players found the back of the net as the Hawks rolled to a 9-0 win over Tusky Valley to claim the Division III sectional title. The Hawks advance to district play Tuesday against Rosecrans, a 5-1 winner over Steubenville Catholic Central, at a site and time to be determined. Other matches • Coshocton gave No. 2 seeded East Liverpool all it could handle before falling 4-3 in a shootout. East Liverpool scored three goals in the last 22 minutes of regulation to tie the score 4-4 and the teams played two scoreless overtimes leading to the shootout. Conner Roahrig had a goal and an assist while Tanner Moats and Ben Batchelor scored goals for the Redskins. • Dover led 1-0 on a Noah Randazzo goal, but host Lake scored the next three for a 3-1 win in the Division I sectional. Dover ended its season at 12-5-1. • Steubenville scored a pair of first-half goals en route to a 2-0 win over visiting West Holmes in a Division II sectional. Hiland 9, Tusky Valley 0 Division III Sectional Final Goals—(H) Sinjon Howell 2; Derek Miller 2; Joe Wengerd; Zach Miller; Braden Mast; Tyson Gingerich; Cameron Miller. Assists—(H) Jared Yoder 3; Derek Miller; Andy Miller; Sinjon Howell; Declan Howell. Page 3 of 3 - Shots on goal—20-2 Hiland. Corner kicks—8-1 Hiland. Saves—(H) Derek Burke 1. (TV) Tyler Boyd 10. Halftime—5-0 Hiland. Records—Hiland 13-5; Tusky Valley 9-6-3. Steubenville 2, West Holmes 0 Division II Sectional Final Goals—(S) Ryan Delelles, Federico Torres. Shots on goal—Steubenville 11-3. Corner kicks—Steubenville 5-0. Saves—(S) Tyler Clevenger 4. (WH) Drew Campbell 5. Halftime—Steubenville 2-0.
